title.narrative: Human right to water affordability and Climate resilience project

description.narrative:
EJCW will convene its affordability task force and plan for a broader convening with agency and legislative staffers with the express goal of developing one or more bills and agency action plans to advance in each relevant forum. EJCW will hire a Sacramento-based organizer (Coalition Coordinator) whose job duties will include organizing and supporting the development of the new water justice network in Sacramento, while EJCW’s Central Coast staffer and a new Central Coast hire will do the same in the Central Coast. EJCW’s HRTW work group (the Safe Water Alliance) will draft research questions for the Governor’s office and/or the Legislature. EJCW’s Bay Area staffer will take lead on expanding EJCW’s work on building resilience in low-income communities of color to the water-related impacts of Climate Change.
EJCW’s director, statewide program assistance, web developer, volunteer filmmaker, and other volunteers, will establish EJCW’s new website and work with members to ensure it is accessible and useful and well-maintained. More detailed activities are provided in the outline below. Only major milestones are listed, so as not to overwhelm the ability of the reader to digest the activity work plan.
to support EJCW's efforts to implement AB685, the human right to water act of CA, particularly as it related to affordability
